## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 431, 718, 501]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. Write in dark blue or black pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 514, 253, 528]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 652, 542]]<|/det|>
If working is needed for any question it must be shown below that question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 543, 375, 556]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators should be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 556, 904, 600]]<|/det|>
If the degree of accuracy is not specified in the question, and if the answer is not exact, give the answer to three significant figures. Give answers in degrees to one decimal place. For \(\pi\) , use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 611, 758, 655]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. The total of the marks for this paper is 104.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 621, 90]]<|/det|>
A car company has three sales people, Anna, Mustapha and Joshua.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 103, 146, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 103, 765, 121]]<|/det|>
During March, Anna sold 21 cars, Mustapha sold 12 cars and Joshua sold 15 cars.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 134, 756, 152]]<|/det|>
Write down and simplify the ratio of the number of cars they sold during March.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[504, 214, 850, 231]]<|/det|>
<form>Anna : Mustapha : Joshua = .......... : .......... : ............ [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 246, 146, 263]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 246, 810, 280]]<|/det|>
Each month, they receive a bonus which is proportional to the number of cars they sell. The total bonus in March is \$1248.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 293, 180, 310]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 293, 510, 310]]<|/det|>

<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 492, 181, 510]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 492, 618, 510]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[623, 616, 890, 634]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[646, 648, 898, 666]]<|/det|>
<form>Joshua \$ ........................................ [2]

The total bonus of \$1248 is \(\frac{3}{7}\) of the total profit in March.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 710, 418, 727]]<|/det|>
Calculate the total profit in March.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[645, 865, 898, 883]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 73, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 507, 88]]<|/det|>
Ella wants to buy a car with a price of \$13 500.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 88, 460, 103]]<|/det|>
The company reduces this price by \(16\%\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 103, 401, 118]]<|/det|>
Ella then pays a deposit of \$500.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 134, 539, 150]]<|/det|>
Show that the amount left for her to pay is \$10 840.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 289, 920, 306]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 320, 144, 337]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 320, 415, 336]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 336, 600, 351]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 367, 180, 384]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 367, 726, 383]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 521, 920, 539]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[677, 706, 918, 721]]<|/det|>
<form>...................................... % [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 196, 557, 212]]<|/det|>
Beindu goes to the market to buy apples and bananas.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 212, 250, 227]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[233, 242, 529, 259]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[233, 273, 533, 289]]<|/det|>
